Issues.Title: refactor(core): remove TestBed.deprecatedOverrideProvider
Issues.Body:
BREAKING CHANGE

In PR #19558, we fixed a bug in `TestBed.overrideProvider` where
eager providers were not being instantiated correctly. However,
it turned out that since this bug had been around for quite a bit,
many apps were relying on the broken behavior where the providers
would not be instantiated. To assist in the transition, the
`TestBed.deprecatedOverrideProvider` method was temporarily
introduced to mimic the old behavior so that apps would have a
longer time period to migrate their code.

2 years and 3 versions later, it is time to remove the temporary
method. This commit removes `TestBed.deprecatedOverrideProvider`
altogether. Any usages of `TestBed.deprecatedOverrideProvider`
should be replaced with `TestBed.overrideProvider`. This may mean
that providers that were not created before will now be instantiated,
which could mean that your tests need to provide more mocks or stubs
for the dependencies of the newly instantiated providers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): remove TestBed.deprecatedOverrideProvider" (#30576)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): handle pipes in i18n attributes properly
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change we processed binding expression (including bindings with pipes) in i18n attributes before we generate update instruction. As a result, slot offsets for pipeBind instructions were calculated incorrectly. Now we perform binding expression processing when we generate "update block" instructions, so offsets are calculated correctly.

This PR resolves FW-1316.

Issues.Title: ngcc generates invalid property metadata
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/compiler-cli` / `ngcc` ### Description Currently when compiling `@angular/cdk/a11y` with `ngcc`, the generated property metadata call (`setClassMetadata`) incorrectly sets metadata for the `autoCapture` property within the `FocusTrap` twice. This means that the first occurrence will be accidentally overwritten and the metadata is discarded. The duplication seems to happen because `autoCapture` declares a `getter` and a `setter`. As far as I could tell the issue is that `ngcc` returns the getter and setter for `reflection.getMembersOfClass(FocusTrap)` but sets decorators that are either defined on getter or setter as `decorators` for both members. This then results in two properties with the same name in the `setClassMetadata` call. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/annotations/src/metadata.ts#L59-L62 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/devversion/ivy-ngcc-generates-duplicate-prop-metadata ## üî• Exception or Error See: https://github.com/angular/components/issues/16066 Defining the same property multiple times seems to cause an exception in IE11 with `use strict` mode. This is actually reasonable as the first declaration is accidentally overwritten in an object literal. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

@angular/*: 8.0.0-rc.4
@angular/cdk: 8.0.0-rc.1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngcc generates invalid property metadata" (#30569)

Issues.Title: Test differential loading on legacy browsers in /integration/bazel
Issues.Body:
`test_saucelabs_bazel` CircleCI cronjob tested in https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/30571.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [ ] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [x] Build related changes
- [x] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

No tests for differential loading.

No way to use protractor_web_test to test on Saucelabs with certain browsers that don't proxy localhost for all ports.

## What is the new behavior?

protractor_web_test by default now uses ports that are proxied for localhost by all browsers. See https://wiki.saucelabs.com/display/DOCS/Sauce+Connect+Proxy+FAQS#SauceConnectProxyFAQS-CanIAccessApplicationsonlocalhost?.

Differential loading of `rollup_bundle` bundles using `web_package` to setup differential loading and `http_server` as server tested against legacy browsers in /integration/bazel e2e test.

@alexeagle A follow up PR should also add a test for differential loading in the non-bazel case but not sure the best way to accomplish this. This PR shows how to use protractor_web_test to test with SauceLabs. In this case the server is an `http_server` that relies on `web_package` to setup the differential loading. How to test the non-bazel angular-cli production bundle with differential loading?

**Note: protractor multiCapabilties not supported under Bazel**

Using a SAUCE_BROWSER environment variable to control which browser is tested against in //test/e2e:prodserver_sauce_test. This is because `multiCapabilities` do not work with protractor under Bazel as protractor spawns new processes for each browser test and new nodejs processes under Bazel don't know how to resolve runfiles. No obvious easy fix for this problem. A shell script /integration/bazel/run_sauce_tests.sh is added to test all the browser variants listed in /integration/bazel/protractor-sauce.conf.js.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

I'm new to angular, and I have the following issue:

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): unable to project into multiple slots with default selector
Issues.Body: With View engine it was possible to declare multiple projection definitions and to programmatically project nodes into the slots. e.g. ```html Spacer ``` Using `ViewContainerRef#createComponent` allowed projecting nodes into one of the both projection defs (through index) This no longer works with Ivy as the projectionDef instruction only retrieves a list of selectors instead of also retrieving entries for reserved projection slots which appear when using the default selector multiple times (as seen above). Two possible solutions to fix this: https://hackmd.io/s/Sy2kQlgTE This PR implements solution (2) where we completely follow the semantics of content projection in view engine.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): unable to project into multiple slots with default selector" (#30561)

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): tighten up path types in ngstc and ngcc
Issues.Body:
Previously, we introduced the "branded" path types, `AbsoluteFsPath` and
`PathSegment` to distinguish between different kinds of path strings used
in the system. It was not possible to implicitly cast from `string` to
these types or from one type to another. The helps to prevent mistakenly
using the wrong type of path string in the wrong place.

This commit goes one step further. It locks down these types so it is not
possible to cast to a `string` either. Now one must use the `.toString()`
method on the branded path to get an actual string type. The branded paths
are still `string` values at runtime and they extend the `String` interface
so that all the string methods, (e.g. `.startsWith()`) can be used directly.

Further it was found that there were places were a string was being used
as a kind of path to represent the import specifier of a module. Such paths
can be absolute or relative but it is still helpful to reason about these
types separately to `string`, `AbsoluteFsPath` and `PathSegment`.

A new type `ModuleSpecifier` has been defined that represents this new
branded path. It has a create helper (`ModuleSpecifier.from()`) but can
be cast implicitly to `AbsoluteFsPath` and `PathSegment` as needed.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): align component template assertions with ViewEngine
Issues.Body:
This is something I ran into a few times while porting tests to `TestBed`. ViewEngine has some assertions against the metadata of a component that verifies things like that it has a template and that it can't have both `template` and `templateUrl`.

* For AoT I've aligned the error messages so they match the ones in ViewEngine and I've added unit tests for them.
* For JIT mode I've only added the error that throws if a component doesn't have a template. I didn't port most of the other errors (checking that `template` is a string, checking that `preserveWhitespaces` is a boolean etc.), because they'll be caught by TS. I also didn't do the error that ensures that both `template` and `templateUrl` aren't defined, because the way the resource resolution works is that it starts loading the `templateUrl` and then sets the result on the `template`, which means that it'll always result in an error. We could throw the error earlier (e.g. in `defineComponent`), but that would be inconsistent with ViewEngine and it wouldn't allow for `TestBed` to assign the template at a later point.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): align component template assertions with ViewEngine" (#30553)

Issues.Title: @angular/service-worker SwPush.requestSubscription not working in Firefox 60.6.1esr
Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: build: update webpack to version 4.32.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| webpack | devDependencies | minor | [`4.31.0` -> `4.32.0`](https://diff.intrinsic.com/webpack/4.31.0/4.32.0) | [source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack) |
| webpack | dependencies | minor | [`4.31.0` -> `4.32.0`](https://diff.intrinsic.com/webpack/4.31.0/4.32.0) | [source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack/webpack</summary>

### [`v4.32.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.32.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.31.0...v4.32.0)

### Features

-   Added `this.mode` to the loader API, to allow loaders to choose defaults by `mode` similar to webpacks options
-   Stack Trace for Errors in rejected Promises from `import()` now includes the stack from where the `import()` was called

### Bugfixes

-   The Parser can now analyse identifiers in rest patterns too
    -   `const { a, ...rest } = obj`, where `rest` conflicts with an imported binding etc.
-   `node: false` now correctly disables `__dirname` and `__filename` too
-   `__dirname` and `__filename` now no longer evaluates to something when `node: false` or `node.__file/dirname: false` is set
    -   `if(__dirname !== "")` is no longer replaced with `if(true)` in such scenarios
-   prefetching chunks is no executed **after** the initial module evaluation
    -   This allows to override i. e. `__webpack_public_path__` for prefetching too
-   fixes a runtime crash when using side-effect-free modules with the DllPlugin

### Contribute

-   CI tests node.js 12 now too
-   webpack-bot now merges dependabot PRs automatically when status checks succeed

</details>

---

# üöÄ Feature request
Update `angular.json` `projects` object when generating a new library component; minimally, include a flag to control it.


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ X] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
I wrote an [SO Question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/56210978/why-angular-cli7-3-9-does-not-update-angular-json-with-new-test-target-when-cre) describing this.

The expected behavior when creating a new component using `angular-cli` is that `angular.json.projects` is updated with an entry describing the newly created component. The observed behavior is that `angular-cli` does not do so.

The `ng test newComponent` worked after I updated `angular.json.projects` to describe the newly created component.

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): downlevel constructor parameter type information
Issues.Body:
The Angular JIT compiler uses the output of TypeScript's `emitDecoratorMetadata` to support dependency injection at runtime.  This option stores type and DI token information so that the runtime JIT compiler can inject the proper provider.  This option is not needed for AOT compilation and the metadata is indirectly stripped from the output due to all Angular decorators being removed during the compilation process.

Unfortunately, the `emitDecoratorMetadata` option does not support forward references (or more generally circular dependencies) within ES2015+ output due to the TypeScript compiler transforming the metadata into a direct reference of the yet to be defined class.  This results in a runtime TDZ error.  This is a known limitation of the `emitDecoratorMetadata` option ([reference](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/27519)).  This situation is not unique to Angular and can occur in any TypeScript code.  As it is marked as a design limitation, it is considered that it cannot be fixed within the current architecture of TypeScript.

As a result, the change in this PR removes the need for the use of the option by storing the DI information in a static property function via the use of the tsickle `ctorParameters` transformation.  By leveraging the existing functionality, no changes to the framework code is necessary.  Also, minimal new code is required within the CLI, as the relevant tsickle code can be extracted and used with several local modifications.

For forward references to function in ES2015+, the `emitDecoratorMetadata` option must be disabled based on the current implementation.  To support both the option and forward references, the metadata generated by TypeScript would need to be altered to remove the type information that would trigger a TDZ error.  However, by doing so the metadata information is no longer useful to Angular and technically incorrect as it will not contain the information from the source code as described by the option.

Addresses: #14424
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): downlevel constructor parameter type information" (#14473)

Issues.Title: Default to production builds
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
I know this is tough due to it being a breaking change with the ecosystem, but I think `ng build` should do a production build by default.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] build
```

### Description
Most of the time, developers should be building for production, and serving for development. It would save a lot of time overall if `ng build` defaulted to production mode.


### Describe the solution you'd like
During the update process to 9 (or some other version), prompt the user if they want to keep the current behavior or migrate to the new behavior, and then default all new projects with `ng new` to production by default.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
None
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Default to production builds" (#14471)

Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| core-js | dependencies | minor | [`3.0.1` -> `3.1.1`](https://diff.intrinsic.com/core-js/3.0.1/3.1.1) | [source](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>zloirock/core-js</summary>

### [`v3.1.1`](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​311---20190521)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/compare/v3.1.0...v3.1.1)

-   Added one more workaround of alternative not completely correct `Symbol` polyfills, [#​550](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/550), [#​554](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/554)
-   Reverted `esnext.string.match-all` in some entry points for fix autogeneration of `core-js-compat/entries` and backward `@babel/preset-env` compatibility

### [`v3.1.0`](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​310---20190520)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/compare/v3.0.1...v3.1.0)

-   `String#matchAll` moved to stable ES, exposed `Symbol.matchAll`, [#​516](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/516)
-   `Promise.allSettled` moved to stage 3, [#​515](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/515)
-   `String#replaceAll` moved to stage 2, behavior updated by the spec draft, [#​524](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/524)
-   `Promise.any` moved to stage 1, [#​517](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/517)
-   Removed `es.regexp.flags` dependency from `es.regexp.to-string`, [#​536](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/536), [#​537](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/537)
-   Fixed IE8- non-enumerable properties support in `Object.{ assign, entries, values }`, [#​541](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/541)
-   Fixed support of primitives in `Object.getOwnPropertySymbols` in Chrome 38 / 39, [#​539](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/539)
-   `window.postMessage`-based task implementation uses location origin over `'*'`, [#​542](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/542)
-   Lookup `PromiseConstructor.resolve` only once in `Promise` combinators, [tc39/ecma262#​1506](https://togithub.com/tc39/ecma262/pull/1506)
-   Temporarily removed `core-js` dependency from `core-js-compat` since it's required for missed at this moment feature
-   Show a message on `postinstall`
-   Added compat data for Chrome 76, FF 67, Node 12

</details>

Issues.Title: Provide `outputHashing` option hashing only chunk and script
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 

I have some raw html files for OGP(Open Graph Protocol), not generating by angular.
these raw html files include css file extracted by Angular-CLI such as  `<link href="/static/styles.css" rel="stylesheet" />` to match the look and style generated by Angular.
to share hashed css file generated by `ng build --prod`, I must manually modify link tag in raw html files...

now `outputHashing` has 4 options.
so, I need 5th option hashing only chunk and script.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è-->

for example, option`scripts` having only chunk and script hash.

```javascript
const hashFormats: { [option: string]: HashFormat } = {
    none:    { chunk: '',                       extract: '',                         file: ''                 , script: '' },
    media:   { chunk: '',                       extract: '',                         file: `.[hash:${length}]`, script: ''  },
    bundles: { chunk: `.[chunkhash:${length}]`, extract: `.[contenthash:${length}]`, file: ''                 , script: `.[hash:${length}]`  },
    all:     { chunk: `.[chunkhash:${length}]`, extract: `.[contenthash:${length}]`, file: `.[hash:${length}]`, script: `.[hash:${length}]`  },
    scripts: { chunk: `.[chunkhash:${length}]`, extract: '',                         file: ''                 , script: `.[hash:${length}]`  },
  };
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
quit preset option. can arbitrarily indicate by key map object.

in angular.json
```json
"outputHashing": {"chunk": true, "extract": false, "file": false, "script": true}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Provide `outputHashing` option hashing only chunk and script" (#14463)

Issues.Title: a path configured in tsconfig.json dosen't work in ./server.ts in Angular universal mode
Issues.Body:
I have created an Agular library and puts its path to paths array in tsconfig.json
note that this path refers to 'src' of the library, not 'dist' folder


tsconfig.json:
```
    "paths": {
      "*": ["node_modules/*", "src/types/*"],
      "myLib": ["projects/myLib/src/public-api"],
      "myLib/*": ["projects/myLib/src/lib/*"]
    }
```

server.ts
```
import { example } from "myLib" //cannot resolve myLib, although when I click in this module in my IDE it directly open the correct path i.e public-api.ts file
import { example } from "projects/myLib/src/public-api" //works!
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "a path configured in tsconfig.json dosen't work in ./server.ts in Angular universal mode" (#14456)

Issues.Title: @angular/cli upgrade breaks karma/jasmine sourcemap reporting
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes. Sourcemaps in karma/jasmine worked fine up to and including@angular/cli 8.0.0.beta.9, but from beta.10 to current (rc.4 today) sourcemaps no longer work. ### Description Example working output from beta.9: ``` Expected true to be falsy. at UserContext. (src/app/app.component.spec.ts:32:18) ``` Example broken output from beta.10+: ``` Error: Expected true to be falsy. at at UserContext. (http://localhost:9877/_karma_webpack_/main.js:304:22) at ZoneDelegate.invoke (http://localhost:9877/_karma_webpack_/polyfills.js:3325:26) at ProxyZoneSpec.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-testing.js.ProxyZoneSpec.onInvoke (http://localhos... ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction * Follow https://angular.io/guide/quickstart and create a new app. * `ng test` and ensure test passes. * add to app.component.spec.ts: ``` it('should fail', () => { expect(true).toBeFalsy(); }); ``` * run `ng test` again and note you get a line number such as ` at UserContext. (src/app/app.component.spec.ts:32:18)` * `ng update --next --all --force` to update to something more recent than 8.0.0.beta.10 * repeat `ng test` and note line numbers no longer help you find your spec in app.component.ts. Instead you see something like this: ``` Error: Expected true to be falsy. at at UserContext. (http://localhost:9877/_karma_webpack_/main.js:304:22) at ZoneDelegate.invoke (http://localhost:9877/_karma_webpack_/polyfills.js:3325:26) at ProxyZoneSpec.push../node_modules/zone.js/dist/zone-testing.js.ProxyZoneSpec.onInvoke (http://localhos... ``` ## üî• Exception or Error n/a ## üåç Your Environment ng version:

Issues.Title: fix(popover-edit): rework host listeners to account for changes in Ivy
Issues.Body: Switches all of the inherited event listeners in `popover-edit` to use `@HostListener`. In Ivy the `host` objects are merged when inheriting, whereas in ViewEngine they are overwritten. This means that with the current setup we'll end up with double event listeners once Ivy lands.

Issues.Title: Material Tabs with lazy loading are reinstantiated on tab clicks
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
After lazy loading a tab, the tab content should persist and not getting reinstantiated on tab changes.

#### What is the current behavior?
A tab change instantiates the new tab content and destroys the previous tab content.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-imxxnk](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-imxxnk?file=app%2Fapp.component.html)

Click on the tabs and observe the console for ngOnInit and NgOnDestroy messages.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.2.15
Material 7.3.7

#### Is there anything else we should know?

Using matTabContent: lazy loading
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Material Tabs with lazy loading are reinstantiated on tab clicks" (#16065)

Issues.Title: Tooltips: Should not overlap
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
I'm not sure if this is a bug or expected behavior. I'm proposing that tooltips don't overlap if you happen to have your mouse positioned onscreen and use keyboard to activate tooltip.

#### What is the current behavior?
Currently you can get tooltips to overlap by using a mouse to set focus and the keyboard focus at the same time. Example is shown with buttons.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-c5w9uu . 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10760551/58049688-0f221e00-7b13-11e9-9526-ba0c6d3033d6.png)  
Set your mouse on one of the move buttons, then use keyboard to tab through buttons. Notice the tooltips overlap.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.2.15
Material 7.3.7

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This may or may not be a bug.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tooltips: Should not overlap" (#16072)

Issues.Title: build: fix examples package generating invalid metadata
Issues.Body:
When building the `@angular/material-examples` package with
Bazel, the generated flat module metadata file does not include
metadata for the `ExampleModule`. This is because there is a
genrule which declares an output with the same name of the
example module source file. This means that the `ng_module`
rule somehow accidentally picks up the genrule output and the
generated flat module metadata file does not include the example
module due https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30259
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix examples package generating invalid metadata" (#16073)

Issues.Title: Make cdk-table extensible
Issues.Body:
The docs say:
> "Think of the CDK as a blank state of well-tested functionality upon which you can develop your own bespoke components."

I'd like to think of it like that, but that is not reflected by reality. In reality, much of the codebase is unnecessarily marked private, and writing bespoke components on top of it is virtually impossible, unless they match the exact use-cases permitted by the authors to enable the Material component framework.

For example, I have been trying to write a custom table component on top of CdkTable. At every turn, I have ran into limitations imposed by the base component's insistence on making vital data private. Simple things like accessing the rendered rows or the definitions are impossible.

If the CDK is genuinely intended to be a development kit, it should default to making data and functionality available to subclasses, not locking down its API as it would be in an end-product component suite. This might make the CDK authors' lives easier, but it is completely contrary to the philosophy of a useful development kit, which should be open to extensibility and unforeseen use-cases, not reflexively hostile to them.

The PR makes a start by marking the private fields and methods of CdkTable protected, so they can be accessed and override in a subclass.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Make cdk-table extensible" (#16069)

Issues.Title: build: no longer use deprecated api in sass_bundle rule
Issues.Body:
Switches away from deprecated Bazel API that now needs to be enabled
explcitly within Bazel 0.24.0 (`incompatible_disallow_old_style_args_add`)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: no longer use deprecated api in sass_bundle rule" (#16064)

Issues.Title: build: fine-grain dependencies for mdc prototypes
Issues.Body:
Currently all mdc prototype secondary entry-points specify
all CDK and Material Bazel targets as dependencies. This
causes significant slower builds and also doesn't follow the
fine-grained dependency pattern.

Fine-grained dependencies have various benefits over
coarced dependencies. We should consider putting
this into a Bazel guide somewhere inside the repository
at some point.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fine-grain dependencies for mdc prototypes" (#16071)

Issues.Title: [Migration] Error when using MatChipInputEvent
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

Migration should properly locate the module from where to import `MatChipInputEvent`.

#### What is the current behavior?

Shows error during migration when encounters `MatChipInputEvent` and does not migrate other imports in same file:
```
ERROR: /my-project/src/app/shared/modules/modals/search-profile/component/search-profile-modal/search-profile-modal.component.ts:8:3 - MatChipInputEvent was not found in the Material library.
```

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

1. `ng new test-app` (with angular v7)
2. `ng add @angular/material`
3. Import anywhere in component code `import {MatChipInputEvent} from '@angular/material';`
4. ng update --next @angular/cli @angular/core @angular/material

And wait until material migrations will complete. Then check logs output and the import will not be migrated in file with `MatChipInputEvent`.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular v8 RC4
Material v8 RC1

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Migration] Error when using MatChipInputEvent" (#16070)

Issues.Title: MatExpansionPanel animates header height when first rendered
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Given an expansion panel with a header `<mat-expansion-panel-header collapsedHeight="10rem" expandedHeight="10rem">` it should be initially rendered at the specified height.

#### What is the current behavior?
The header is rendered at it's standard height, then animates to the specified height

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-48ryox?embed=1&file=app/expansion-overview-example.html)

Issues.Title: `MatSelectionList` should update option selection state when list of options changes
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
`MatSelectionList` should update option selection state when list of options changes

#### What is the current behavior?
If you change the list of options after the view has been initialised, `MatSelectionList` does not update the model of the new options to reflect that they are selected in the model.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-ptk4tc?file=app/app.component.ts

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Latest StackBlitz template

#### Is there anything else we should know?
`MatSelectionList` should listen to `options.changes` on the `options` `QueryList`: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/fc0b971509d0ec0b4a227aa403c31a5f5b0e6f26/src/material/list/selection-list.ts#L323

This is how `MatSelect` works:
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/9eeb4b5aa0473c0815a73bfe3c2ed6164d86a3b3/src/material/select/select.ts#L550
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`MatSelectionList` should update option selection state when list of options changes" (#16062)

Issues.Body: Fixes consumers not being able to override the `type` of the buttons inside a popover.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(popover-edit): unable to change type of popover buttons" (#16058)

Issues.Title: fix(popover-edit): incorrectly caching values for more than one control
Issues.Body: Currently the edit popover uses the first `valueChange` event to know when to cache the value of its form so that it can revert to it if the user presess the `revert` button. This breaks down if the form has more than one control, because it'll emit a `valueChange` for each control that gets added. These changes fix the issue by using `NgZone` to wait for the form to be initialized.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(popover-edit): incorrectly caching values for more than one control" (#16057)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(button): avoid direct access to nativeElement for consistency" (#16056)

Issues.Title: feat(tabs): support pagination in nav bar
Issues.Body:
Adds support for pagination to `mat-tab-nav-bar` by moving some code around so that it can be reused from the `mat-tab-group`.

Fixes #2177.

**Some outstanding questions:**
* How should we deal with the `tabindex` in `mat-tab-nav-bar`? Currently all enabled links have `tabindex="0"`, but now that we support keyboard navigation, we could switch to the same approach as `mat-tab-group`.
* With these changes the tab header styles are imported in the Sass of both `mat-tab-nav-bar` and `mat-tab-header`. This means that these styles will be included twice and I don't think there's a nice way around it. We can include the same file through `styleUrls`, however our style inlining won't de-duplicate the styles in that case either.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(tabs): support pagination in nav bar" (#16055)

Issues.Title: CDK Stepper footer through ngTemplateOutlet not working
Issues.Body:
I am creating a generic stepper component which uses angular cdk . I want the header, footer , steps to passed through template references.

#### What is the expected behavior?
Stepper CDK Footer with cdkStepperPrevious, cdkStepperNext directives should work when passed through ngTemplateOutlet.

#### What is the current behavior?

Issues.Title: fix(table): not clearing some internal references on destroy
Issues.Body: `CdkTable` keeps track of various definitions internally in order to render itself, however some of them weren't being cleared on destroy which could lead to memory leaks. These changes add some extra logic to clear the tracked references.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(table): not clearing some internal references on destroy" (#16051)

Issues.Title: [Datepicker] - Prevent autocomplete functionality
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Add the option to prevent Datepicker from auto filling a date.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
Currently Datepicker does not autocomplete a date when 'Moment' considers the current input value as an invalid date. Since I need to change the business rule for the autocomplete feature (client requirement for years specifically), it would be great if I can stop the autofill in any case (not only when date is invalid) and create my own logic in a kind of middleware and send manually the new value I want to display.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Current version:
    "@angular/material": "^7.3.4",
    "@angular/material-moment-adapter": "7.3.4",
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Datepicker] - Prevent autocomplete functionality" (#16048)

Issues.Title: fix(table): error in Ivy for coerced multiTemplateDataRows
Issues.Body:
Fixes an error that is thrown by the table in Ivy, if `multiTemplateDataRows` is set as a static attribute. The timing for setters of static attributes is slightly different in Ivy, which means that we need an extra null check.

Fixes #16044.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(table): error in Ivy for coerced multiTemplateDataRows" (#16047)
